intro: Oxymitra longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered oxymitra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptical in shape, with a smooth surface. Oxymitra longiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
